As the Romans do: University of Otago’s time-honoured tradition lights up the night https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/as-the-romans-do-university-of-otagos-time-honoured-tradition-lights-up-the-night/BDM4HX4MDJHV3J3CZIVOCF6VWE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/as-the-romans-do-university-of-otagos-time-honoured-tradition-lights-up-the-night/BDM4HX4MDJHV3J3CZIVOCF6VWE/ Ben TomsettThe party is the first major event on the student calendar in Dunedin. Wed, 21 Feb 2024 22:01:25 +0000 First-year students at the University of Otago come together on the Union Lawn adorned in togas, immersing themselves in music, dance, for the first big event on the student calendar. Northland photographer Kirsty Halliday claims gold in Christchurch masters tournaments https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/northland-photographer-kirsty-halliday-claims-gold-in-christchurch-masters-tournaments/3STYFZK6DFAU5JS5UE46WVUCPY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/northland-photographer-kirsty-halliday-claims-gold-in-christchurch-masters-tournaments/3STYFZK6DFAU5JS5UE46WVUCPY/ Halliday's success driven by desire to inspire others to chase their dreams Wed, 21 Feb 2024 22:00:00 +0000 Northland's Kirsty Halliday has risen above adversity to claim an impressive five gold medals at the recent New Zealand Masters Track & Field Championships event in Christchurch.
Southland oat growing family honoured to have cultivar named after them https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/southland-oat-forming-family-honoured-to-have-cultivar-named-after-them/NRYHS5FB2VF4XMJDOWKZVFJCAA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/the-country/news/southland-oat-forming-family-honoured-to-have-cultivar-named-after-them/NRYHS5FB2VF4XMJDOWKZVFJCAA/ Shawn McAvinueFive generations of the Gardyne family had been growing oats north of Gore since 1876. Wed, 21 Feb 2024 21:54:32 +0000 Southland oat growers Graeme and Elspeth Gardyne display a plaque from Plant Research Ltd recognising the outstanding generational contribution of the Gardyne family to the New Zealand oat industry and the official renaming of the new oat variety PRL12-10-2 to Gardyne.
